ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It was a good course. Usually three papers to read per week and you fill out the same worksheet for each. Three problem sets, and one final paper (on any economic institution you want to write about) with periodic drafts so that it isn't a lot of work all at the end like most seminars. I have no idea how I did in the course, but the papers were interesting. Participation does not factor into the grade but discussion still was good. We all liked the papers from the second half more, so I suspect that next year those will make up more of the course.
Good theoretical way to understand political economy of institutions.
Good econ seminar where you learn how to read econ papers.
A very chill senior seminar. You'll learn a lot about how institutions in the developed world got started.
